column1: Vichuga (Russian: Ви́чуга) is a town in Ivanovo Oblast
column3: located 65 kilometers (40 mi) northeast of Ivanovo. Population: 37

column1: Vichuga was first mentioned as a volost in the will of Ivan III in 1504. Marshal of the Soviet Union Aleksandr Mikhaylovich Vasilevsky was born in Novaya Golchikha
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Vichuga serves as the administrative center of Vichugsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the Town of Vichuga—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Vichuga is incorporated as Vichuga Urban Okrug.
